info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:37PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fergus County through 430 PM MDT... At 336 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles southeast of Lewistown, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Fergus County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also possible with this storm, and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
